author: Francisco Cacho
title: La DANA continúa sobre España, poniendo en aviso a cinco comunidades autónomas
text: Seguirá dejando precipitaciones La DANA continúa sobre España, poniendo en aviso a cinco comunidades autónomas La DANA no ha terminado. En puntos como Huelva continúan activos los avisos rojos, aunque se espera que se vayan desactivando a lo largo de la tarde. En concreto, las precipitaciones se centran este viernes en dos zonas: el oeste de Andalucía y Extremadura, y el nordeste de la península. Pese a todo, parece que este temporal va a ir perdiendo fuerza, aunque seguirá dejando precipitaciones que serán fuertes o persistentes al menos hasta el sábado en varias zonas de la península y Baleares, a la espera de que el domingo se inicie una transición hacia un tiempo más estable. Este viernes continuarán las precipitaciones en la Comunidad Valenciana, en el cuadrante sudoeste peninsular, sudoeste de Castilla y León, Aragón, Cataluña, Levante y Baleares, sin descartarse en amplias zonas cercanas. La Aemet ha activado para hoy avisos en la Comunidad Valenciana, Andalucía, Baleares, Cataluña y Extremadura. En diferentes zonas del litoral de Huelva están activos el aviso rojo (riesgo extremo), naranja (riesgo importante) y amarillo por previsiones de precipitación acumulada de 140 litros en doce horas y se prevé que continúen con "gran intensidad" en las zonas de aviso durante las próximas horas. Asimismo, se activado el aviso naranja en las islas del archipiélago balear donde se pueden registrar hasta 120 litros por metro cuadrado en pocas horas; asimismo el naranja está activo en Cataluña, y el amarillo en la Comunidad Valenciana y Extremadura. Pueden registrarse chubascos y tormentas localmente fuertes y/o persistentes en el extremo occidental de Andalucía y en el bajo Ebro y Baleares, sin descartar zonas de la vertiente sur del sistema Central occidental. Más Noticias - [Alerta naranja en el litoral valenciano, Castellón y Tarragona por fuertes lluvias](https://www.lasexta.com/noticias/el-tiempo/alerta-tormentas-valencia-algunos-puntos-como-cullera-podrian-caer-mas-100-litros-metro-cuadrado-proximas-horas_2024110367278922d058410001cd1815.html) - [El veranillo de San Miguel vuelve a traer un calor que se mantendrá hasta el próximo miércoles](https://www.lasexta.com/noticias/el-tiempo/veranillo-san-miguel-vuelve-traer-calor-que-mantendra-proximo-miercoles_2024092966f978fd3c87870001f0b279.html) - [Llega la borrasca de gran impacto Aitor, el primer temporal del otoño, con lluvias y tormentas](https://www.lasexta.com/noticias/el-tiempo/llega-borrasca-gran-impacto-aitor-primer-temporal-otono-lluvias-tormentas_2024092466f290a33c87870001ea119e.html) - [El verano se despide con avisos naranjas por lluvias y tormentas en Aragón, Cataluña, Valencia y Baleares](https://www.lasexta.com/noticias/el-tiempo/verano-despide-avisos-naranjas-lluvias-tormentas-aragon-cataluna-valencia-baleares_2024092166ee734fb3741e0001ede7a1.html) - [Las tormentas dejan inundaciones en varios puntos de España, con Tarragona y Castellón en nivel naranja](https://www.lasexta.com/noticias/el-tiempo/tormentas-dejan-inundaciones-varios-puntos-espana-tarragona-castellon-nivel-naranja_2024092066ed4a203c87870001e600ff.html) El sábado, la inestabilidad continuará en el área mediterránea oriental y en el suroeste de Andalucía, con previsión de chubascos y tormentas que todavía pueden ser localmente fuertes y/o persistentes en Tarragona, Castellón, Valencia y Baleares, sin descartarse que se registren en Cádiz y el oeste de Málaga, Murcia, ambas mesetas y montañas del extremo norte.

author: archyde
title: the price of the Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra smartphone drops to less than €300
text:
2023-12-28 10:00:35
The Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra drops below €300 on Cdiscount. A godsend if you want to change your smartphone before the new year.
Released in 2020, the Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra remains a sure value in the smartphone market. It effectively stands out as a high-performance device with unrivaled value for money. On Cdiscount, it is currently available at only €296. An ideal opportunity to get a 5G smartphone without ruining your wallet.
Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra : un smartphone ultra performant
The Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra, a powerful smartphone, is powered by the Exynos 990 chip and 12 GB of RAM, offering exceptional performance for browsing, gaming sessions or viewing content on your favorite SVOD platforms. The 6.9-inch AMOLED display, with a resolution of 3200×1440 pixels, provides an immersive visual experience. Featuring 128 GB of storage, this smartphone is also equipped with a 5,000 mAh battery, ensuring up to 18 hours of battery life with an active Internet connection.
In terms of photography, the Galaxy S20 Ultra is equipped with a quadruple rear lens, including a 108-megapixel main sensor, a 12-megapixel ultra-wide-angle module, a 48-megapixel telephoto lens, and a DepthVision camera. On the front, a 40-megapixel camera is dedicated to selfies and video calls. Explore the photographic excellence and cutting-edge performance of the Samsung Galaxy S20 Ultra, a smartphone that redefines standards in power and imaging.
A prestigious smartphone at a low price
The Galaxy S20 Ultra shines with its exceptional features covering graphics, photos, videos, speed, connectivity, resolution and size. This smartphone offers an unparalleled user experience, enabling smooth execution of everyday tasks and pushing the limits of performance. The exceptional resolution screen offers total immersion, ideal for the most demanding games. Explore your creativity with the camera’s extensive settings, offering endless possibilities for capturing ever more beautiful images

author: Colten Bartholomew cbartholomew@madison.com
title: 'I'm hurting, but I still have to keep going for her': Badgers cornerback deals with his mom's death
text:
Amare Snowden was losing control.
He was sitting against a wall outside of a meeting room at UW-Platteville during the University of Wisconsin football team’s training camp and physically rejecting the news he’d just been given. Snowden’s mother, Angela Key, died at the age of 42 on Aug. 7, a bit more than a week into the grind of the off-site portion of preseason practices.
Snowden’s grandmother called to tell him of Key’s death, and a new phase of his life had just begun.
“It was very traumatizing, heartbreaking for me,” Snowden said Tuesday. “Just had to … not just have to deal with it, but I just had to take that lump of depression and emotions.”
Snowden, a redshirt freshman cornerback for the Badgers, was the last one out of the meeting room that day. Through tears, he repeatedly slammed his phone against the tile floor outside the meeting room, breaking the device. Senior cornerback RJ Delancy III did what he could to console his teammate.
People are also reading…
The transfer from Toledo experienced the same anguish as Snowden, having lost his father suddenly in 2020. He told Snowden words that have helped keep Snowden grounded and able to continue pushing heading into the team’s opener at 8 p.m. Friday against Western Michigan.
“I told him straight up,” Delancy said, "'Don’t let nobody tell you that you’ll be OK. You’ll never be OK.'"
’The goofy, big kid’
Snowden always could count on his biggest cheerleader’s encouragement growing up.
He was one of Key’s three children, but all of them felt her energy from the stands or the sidelines. Key worked as a nurse at the Henry Ford Cancer Institute’s service line, and Snowden said he saw how she invested energy into each of her children every day.
“She loved her kids, supportive, caring,” he said. “She was always asking if I'm good. … Any nick, bruise, sickness I had, she took care of it.
“Goofy, loving, funny. She loved to dance. That’s why I think I fall under that, being just the goofy, big kid. Always laughing, can dance a little bit — we both had no, got no rhythm. I fall under that. So I feel some of those traits came from her.”
Snowden exceled at football but also was a star baseball player, a lefty pitcher who had multiple Division I offers. That was the path that Key was hoping her son would take, but she stood behind him when he followed coach Luke Fickell and flipped his commitment from Cincinnati to Wisconsin, ending his chances of playing both sports in college.
“She’s baseball all the way,” Snowden said smiling. “My mom didn't really know nothing about football, but she knew that the mental (side) was draining, for sure, college athlete and being a student at the same time. So it was hard, going to miss the check-ups and just checking on the mental and stuff like that. But I know she's in a better place now.”
Snowden said his family’s awaiting answers regarding how Key died.
Snowden often carries a baseball with him. It’s a comfort device — feeling the raised seams and stitches helps him to be present in the moment. His baseballs helped him through the test of stamina that training camp presents, and they now hold even more meaning as a channel through which he can connect with his mother.
“Just being able to rub it, being in the now,” Snowden said, “that helped me a lot, just being mentally here, in the moment. I don't know if people know, but fall camp is from sunup to sundown. You don't stop.
“I always think about like, ‘Fall camp, it just had to …’”
Snowden paused for a bit, knowing he wouldn’t have been prepared for this loss at any moment.
“I took it as a challenge, like you just gotta keep going. Fall camp is sunup to sundown, it don't wait on nobody. You maybe get, what, an hour or two just to relax and get to ourselves? But other than that it's just football and work. I had the baseball to deal and try to ease my pain and ease my mind.”
Snowden didn’t practice for two days after he received the news of his mother’s death. That decision angered him in the moment, but he now says he appreciates Fickell and cornerbacks coach Paul Haynes keeping him out of those sessions. He didn’t leave camp, miss a practice or meeting until last week when he returned to Detroit for Key’s funeral. Snowden said seeing family was both cathartic and difficult given the circumstances, and the trip was a quick turnaround to be back in Madison for a team meeting Sunday.
Coaches, teammates provide needed support
Snowden credits Fickell and Haynes’ consistency and thoroughness of support over the past month. Both have been actively reaching out to him, giving him chances to verbalize his ache when he needs to and providing him space when he needs it. Fickell, who’s known Snowden and his family for the better part of five years, has been in contact with both sides in an effort to support Snowden.
“I don't have any like, nothing to fall back on to say I've been through it, you know, so it's difficult,” Fickell said. “But I think when you have a relationship with those guys, when it starts in recruiting and it's continuous, it’s not like there's some magic words you can say, but that's why I think it's so critical.
“That's hard on anybody, a guy could be in the NFL (and it’d be hard), but 18 to 22, the first time you're away from home, that's one of the things I worry about with where the evolution of college ball could be going into more of a transactional world, that things like this on an 18, 19 year old, can get lost, right? I mean, they could just pass it off to some expert when that's good, but I think if they don't have the support from around them and the relationships around them, it's going to be really, really difficult for those guys. And so fortunate enough to have known the family for a long time and he feels comfortable coming up and talking and being able to air some of that. And so from both sides, that makes me feel really good about the relationship we do have as well.”
Having teammates like Delancy and Fourqurean, the latter of which is also Snowden’s roommate, provides sounding boards who have firsthand knowledge and sources of encouragement.
“When people say, it’s going to be OK — because that's the first thing people would say — but it's truly not,” Snowden said about the advice his veteran teammates have given him. “Them two guys, they been through it. … They helped me through it. And it's still fresh on me. It's so fresh on me. I gotta just keep going, gotta keep playing, let's get my mind out of it and just keep balling.”
Added Delancy: “I told him how I took it when I found out my dad died. I told him, my reaction was the same as his. But I told him at the end of the day, that’s not going to do nothing but make you more angry. I told him, 'Make sure you don’t hold it in. You can go somewhere and cry it out. If you hold it out, it’s just going to build anger up in you, which is what it did for me.’ But I realized that’s not the answer. Amare took that and went with it. … I told him I love him.”
Other cornerbacks were impressed with Snowden’s ability to continue playing through his tragedy, let alone continue to be the good-natured teammate they’ve come to know.
“He's been a really good, really good guy to be around,” cornerback Ricardo Hallman said. “I know he told me being around the guys and being around football helped him out a lot with the emotions he's going through. So just we constantly let him know that we're here for him, whatever he needs to talk about, whatever he needs from us, he knows that he can lean on us.”
Snowden will run through the tunnel at Camp Randall on Friday as part of the Badgers two-deep, a boundary cornerback expected to be available to sub in at a moment’s notice. He’ll do so knowing healing isn’t a linear process.
“It's hard, man,” he said. “It's even … even if she was alive, things are still hard being a college athlete and stuff like that. But it’s what you live for. I took it on as a challenge. Yes, I'm hurting, but I still have to keep going for her, for rest of my family, for my two brothers back at home that doesn't have our mom … just being there for them, being a safety blanket for them, both of those guys and my grandma, too. My dad called me his ‘strong child’ on his side. I don't really get too emotional. But when things hurt, they hurt.”

author: 网易
title: 这可是女足次级别！纽卡女足vs桑德兰售出28600张票，创队史纪录|英冠|桑德兰队_网易订阅
text: 直播吧3月20日讯 纽卡女足官方发文，球队在女足英冠主场迎战桑德兰女足的比赛售出28600张票，这创下了纽卡女足的队史纪录。

author: 经济日报
title: 中国援塞体育场维修项目顺利移交 _ 东方财富网
text:
近日，中国援塞内加尔4个体育场维修项目竣工移交仪式在塞首都达喀尔市中心的桑戈尔体育场举行。该项目自2022年开工，涵盖桑戈尔体育场及考拉克、久尔贝勒、济金绍尔3个地方体育场的升级改造。其中，桑戈尔体育场于20世纪80年代由中国政府援建，经过此次结构加固、设施更新等系统性改造，成为该国最现代化的体育场之一。其余3座地方场馆也得到升级，为推动塞内加尔全民健身事业发展注入强劲动能。
　　翻新后的体育场建筑宏伟、设施先进，工程质量得到当地广泛认可和称赞。移交仪式上，塞内加尔青年、体育和文化部部长哈迪·盖伊表示，“今天的活动不仅是工程移交仪式，更是彰显塞中友谊的重要时刻。桑戈尔体育场自20世纪80年代由中国援建以来，始终见证着塞中两国的深厚情谊。今天，它以崭新的面貌重新绽放光彩，离不开中方的慷慨支持和塞中双方建设者的辛勤付出。这座场馆的升级改造，不仅提升了设施条件，更体现出两国在体育、文化领域合作的持续深化”。
　　中国驻塞内加尔使馆临时代办李艳表示，援塞4个体育场维修项目是新世纪以来中国在塞实施的规模最大的援助工程，项目顺利移交标志着中塞务实合作迈上新台阶。中国将一如既往坚定支持塞内加尔经济社会发展，愿与塞方携手，将包括体育在内的多领域合作推向新高度，开创两国关系更加紧密、更加丰富的新篇章。
　　据了解，施工团队 中国建筑 集团克服场地分散、工程复杂等难题，实现高效履约。桑戈尔体育场原钢罩棚锈蚀变形，存在垮塌风险，总拆除面积达4015平方米。施工团队通过三维建模对拆除过程进行全流程应力模拟，采用分段切割工艺控制切割顺序与吊装点位，仅用38天便完成拆除任务。新建罩棚采用大跨度空间桁架体系，通过数字化手段优化吊装路径，创新应用可移动焊接操作平台，实现1600余吨钢结构构件毫米级精准安装。据统计，桑戈尔体育场总计5076块预制混凝土看台板中，97%存在贯穿性裂缝、混凝土剥落及钢筋锈蚀等结构性病害，施工团队自主研发自适应调节钢制模具，实现作业流程标准化，节约工期45天，质量合格率显著提升。2024年中非合作论坛期间，塞内加尔总统法耶高度赞扬中国企业在施工过程中展现的专业能力和技术水平。
　　项目实施过程中，施工团队积极承担社会责任，累计为当地创造500余个就业岗位，其中技术岗位占比80%；向当地学校捐赠照明灯具，联合中方援塞医疗队开展义诊，被当地媒体称赞为“有温度的援助”。
（文章来源：经济日报）

author: Anna Martini
title: Premio Innovazione Toscana 2025: Il tema dell'anno è la sicurezza sul lavoro - intoscana
text:
Premio Innovazione Toscana 2025: Il tema dell’anno è la sicurezza sul lavoro
Si può partecipare gratuitamente fino al 30 giugno. In palio ci sono 85mila euro. E' possibile candidare il proprio progetto in una delle 4 categorie, più un premio speciale dedicato ai giovani
Il Consiglio regionale sostiene le imprese che scrivono il futuro e anche quest’anno lo fa concretamente con l’ottava edizione del Premio Innovazione Toscana Amerigo Vespucci promosso insieme a Confindustria Toscana con l’organizzazione di Digital Innovation Hub Toscana e Sviluppo Toscana.
In palio quest’anno ci sono 85mila euro destinati alle imprese e alle startup toscane per sostenere e valorizzare la ricerca e l’innovazione tecnologica, digitale e sostenibile e promuovere l’iniziativa giovanile e il potenziale innovativo del territorio.
La partecipazione è gratuita. Possono partecipare al Premio imprese private, in forma individuale o in rete, e startup innovative e candidare i propri progetti entro il 30 giugno in una delle seguenti categorie:
Start up innovative
Ricerca, Sviluppo e Innovazione Digitale e Sostenibile
Brevetti
Sicurezza Informatica, Strategica, Energetica e Infrastrutturale (Sezione Speciale 2025)
Premio speciale “Giovani” 2025
Sono 9 i premi:
4 premi da 15mila euro ciascuno al 1° progetto classificato in ogni Sezione;
4 premi da 5mila euro ciascuno al 2° miglior progetto classificato in ogni Sezione;
1 premio speciale da 5mila euro al miglior progetto presentato, ma non risultante vincitore all’interno di una delle Sezioni del Premio, da parte di un’impresa giovanile.
L’edizione 2025 del Premio Regionale Innovazione Toscana “Amerigo Vespucci” è stata presentata a Palazzo del Pegaso dal Presidente del Consiglio Regionale della Toscana Antonio Mazzeo insieme al consigliere segretario del’ufficio di Presidenza Diego Petrucci con Maurizio Bigazzi presidente di Confindustria Toscana, Silvia Ramondetta presidente del Premio Innovazione Toscana, Fabrizio Bernini Presidente Digital Innovation Hub Toscana, Gianluca Angusti, Presidente della Commissione Giudicatrice
Per approfondire: www.intoscana.it
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing
